import numpy as np
import random as ram
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import scipy
from scipy import stats
from scipy.stats import poisson
from scipy.stats import rayleigh
from scipy.stats import norm
from scipy.stats import lognorm
import math as math

##a
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)
plt.subplots_adjust(top = 1, right = 1.5)
plt.title("Distribution for the sum of different days")
plt.xlabel("The number of cosmic ray Number")
plt.ylabel("Probbility density")
mu = 4
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 11)
y0 = poisson.pmf(x, mu)
y_sumOfOneDay= y0
y_sumOfTwoDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfOneDay, y0)
y_sumOfThreeDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfTwoDays, y0)
y_sumOfFourDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfThreeDays, y0)

ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 10, 11),y_sumOfOneDay, '.', label = 'sumOfOneDay')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 20, 21),y_sumOfTwoDays, '.', label = 'sumOfTwoDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 30, 31),y_sumOfThreeDays, '.', label = 'sumOfThreeDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 40, 41),y_sumOfFourDays, '.', label = 'sumOfFourDays')
        


plt.legend()
plt.show()





# ax.plot(x, norm.pdf((x-mean)/np.sqrt(variance)),'r-', lw=5, alpha=0.6, label='norm pdf')

##b
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)
y_sumOfFiveDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfFourDays, y0)
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 50, 51), y_sumOfFiveDays, '.', label = 'y_sumOfFiveDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 50, 51), poisson.pmf(np.linspace(0, 50, 51), mu * 5), label = 'possion Distribution')
plt.show()
As we saw, the distribution are overlap with Possion distribution

##c
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)
plt.subplots_adjust(top = 1, right = 1.5)
plt.title("Distribution for the average of different days")
plt.xlabel("The number of cosmic ray Number")
plt.ylabel("Probaility density")


ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 10, 11),y_sumOfOneDay, '*', label = 'sumOfOneDay')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 20, 21)/2,y_sumOfTwoDays, '.', label = 'sumOfTwoDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 30, 31)/3,y_sumOfThreeDays, '-', label = 'sumOfThreeDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 40, 41)/4,y_sumOfFourDays, '.-', label = 'sumOfFourDays')
        

plt.legend()

plt.show()

#d
days = 5
Y = 9
gamma_rays = days * Y
p = 1 - poisson.cdf(gamma_rays, mu * days)
sigma = norm.ppf(p)
print(sigma)

## a

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)
plt.subplots_adjust(top = 1, right = 1.5)
plt.title("Distribution for the sum of different days")
plt.xlabel("The number of cosmic ray Number")
plt.ylabel("Probbility density")
mu = 2
x = np.linspace(0, 10)
y0 = rayleigh.pdf(x, mu)
y_sumOfOneDay= y0
y_sumOfTwoDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfOneDay, y0)
y_sumOfThreeDays = np.convolve(y_sumOfTwoDays, y0)

ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 100), y_sumOfOneDay, label = 'sumOfOneDay')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 100,99), y_sumOfTwoDays, label = 'sumOfTwoDays')
ax.plot(np.linspace(0, 100,148), y_sumOfThreeDays, label = 'sumOfThreeDays')


plt.legend()
plt.show()
Yes, it close to Gaussian distribution.

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)


X = 15
Y = 26
sigma_norm = 5
x_norm = np.linspace(0, 20, 10000)
p_norm = stats.norm.pdf(x_norm, 10, sigma_norm)
plt.title('Probability Distribution for a Specific Pixel')
plt.xlabel('Numbers of events')
plt.ylabel('Probability Mass')
plt.plot(x_norm, p_norm)
plt.show()
p_signal = stats.norm.cdf(Y, 10, 2)
sigma = stats.norm.ppf(p_signal)
print(sigma)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1)
plt.title('Probability Distribution for 10k pixel')
plt.xlabel('number of Events')
plt.ylabel('Probability Mass')
p_norm10k = p_norm * 10000
plt.plot(x_norm, p_norm10k)
plt.show()

#A) Calculate the signal required for a 5-sigma detection in Version 1
p_1 = 1 - stats.norm.cdf(5)
signal_1 = stats.norm.ppf(1 - p_1, 10, 2)
print(signal_1)

# B) Calculate the signal required for a 5-sigma detection in Version 2
signal_10k = stats.norm.ppf(1-p_1/10000, 10, 2)
print(signal_10k)

# C) Discuss how much brighter the signal must be for discoverey if you have a trials factor of 10k. Looking at your probability distributions, explain why the sensitivity penalty due to a trials factor is so low.
# D) If you changed the trials factor significantly (orders of magnitude), how large is the effect on your 5-sigma sensitivity threshold?

signal_new = stats.norm.ppf(1-p_1/1000000000, 10, 2)
print( signal_new)
diff2 = (signal_new - signal_1)/2
print(diff2)
